item.lang_en_phrase_text: The color of the veil is black.
item.hint_layer_1: A definite noun that starts with the letter ح
item.feedback_layer_1: The subject of the sentence has two parts: the first is an indefinite word لون and the second is definite الحجاب
item.feedback_layer_2: The first word لَوْنُ is the subject of the sentence and is paired with /Damma/. The second word الحِجابِ goes with /kasra/.
item.hint_layer_3: A definite, four-letter word derived from the verb حَجَبَ, meaning to cover.
item.feedback_layer_3: Islamic veils, as well as black gloves, socks and burkas, are commonly imported from Afghanistan and Iran.

item.lang_en_phrase_text: The officer has a thin mustache.
item.hint_layer_1: The first letter in the missing word is ش
item.feedback_layer_1: In Arabic, the second word له consists of two parts: ل and ه
item.feedback_layer_2: شارب رفيع means a thin mustache. رفيع is the masculine form of thin. Its feminine form is رَفيعَة, marked with ة /taa marbouta/.
item.hint_layer_3: This is a singular noun. Its plural form is شَوارب
item.feedback_layer_3: The legal age for marriage is twenty-one for men, eighteen for women.

item.lang_en_phrase_text: I saw a man wearing a yellow shirt.
item.hint_layer_1: The first letter is letter in the missing word is ر
item.feedback_layer_1: This is an example of a sentence that starts with a verb. رأيتُ is made of the verb رأى to see and /taa/ (I).
item.feedback_layer_2: A /burnous/ (a sleeveless coat) is worn by Algerian men. The Algerian traditional dress is one of the most indicative of the North African region.
item.hint_layer_3: An indefinite noun acts as an object, with a final /alif/ as a marker.
item.feedback_layer_3: The traditional men's costume of Algeria consists of a /gandoura/, a cloak made of white or brown wool.

item.lang_en_phrase_text: An old man wearing a white garment.
item.hint_layer_1: An adjective that starts with the letter ع
item.feedback_layer_1: رجل عجوز means an old man. عجوز is also used to describe an old woman.
item.feedback_layer_2: جلباب أبيض means white garment. جلبلب is traditional dress for Arabs.
item.hint_layer_3: A four-letter adjective. Its plural form is عجزة or عجائز
item.feedback_layer_3: In Algeria, men usually wear white /burnous/ in the summer, which may be beautifully embroidered with various designs.

item.hint_layer_1: A feminine adjective that starts with the letter س
item.feedback_layer_1: امرأة بدينة means an overweight woman. The masculine form of سمينة is سمين The term /badeen/ is also commonly used in MSA.
item.feedback_layer_2: امرأة سمينة is pronounced /imRa-atun sameenah/. The /taa marboutah/ is pronounced as the final letter ت /taa/ when it is followed by another noun.
item.hint_layer_3: A derivative of the key word is سَمَن, which means butter.
item.feedback_layer_3: A typical woman in Algeria wears a dress known as a /haik/, which is a veil that covers the woman from head to toe.

item.lang_en_phrase_text: My father has a white beard.
item.hint_layer_1: A feminine noun used to describe men.
item.feedback_layer_1: لحية بيضاء means a white beard. The color أبيض (white) is used in Arabic to refer to gray hair in English.
item.feedback_layer_2: Algeria is known as the Land of the Million Martyrs, a reference to its war of independence from 1954-62.
item.hint_layer_3: A four-letter noun, that starts with the letter ل
item.feedback_layer_3: In Algeria, the Armed Islamic Group (GIA) conducted a violent campaign of civilian massacres between 1992-98.

item.lang_en_phrase_text: The doctor is bald and has a black beard.
item.hint_layer_1: An adjective used mainly to describe men.
item.feedback_layer_1: French is used in medical school in Algeria as the main subject language.
item.feedback_layer_2: The Algerian government provides free undergraduate education to Algerians. It takes students seven years to graduate from medical school.
item.hint_layer_3: A four-letter adjective that starts with the letter أ
item.feedback_layer_3: During a 2003 earthquake in northern Algeria in which 2,700 died and 7,000 were injured, Doctors Without Borders provided care.

item.lang_en_phrase_text: I saw a woman wearing sunglasses.
item.hint_layer_1: A singular noun, but its English equivalent is plural.
item.feedback_layer_1: نظّارة comes from the verb نَظّر, which means to make someone see.
item.feedback_layer_2: نظّارة طبية means prescription glasses. طبية literally means medical.
item.hint_layer_3: The noun is derived from the verb نَظَرَ
item.feedback_layer_3: The plural of نظارة is نَظّارات . Both are used interchangeably in Arabic to refer to glasses.

item.lang_en_phrase_text: A tall girl entered the office.
item.hint_layer_1: A feminine adjective that starts with the letter ط
item.feedback_layer_2: During the 1962 Algerian War of Independence, women fought as equals alongside men.
item.hint_layer_3: The adjective is derived from the verb طَوَلَ
item.feedback_layer_3: Jamila Bouhired is an Algerian revolutionary who opposed French colonial rule of Algeria. She is regarded as a hero in Algeria.
